title: Rename 'endpoint' to 'uri' where it makes sense

labels.name: 🚜 refactor
labels.description: Change the code, not the functionality

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

body:
I’m renaming a bunch of “endpoint” in our code to “uri”. Reminder of the nomenclature:

```
ORIGIN:   scheme://host:port
ENDPOINT: /endpoint
URL/URI:  scheme://host:port/endpoint
```

(URI and URL are technically different things, but since we called it `re_uri`, I suggest we stick with “URI”)

title: fix-ci: update to tokio 1.44.2 to fix RUSTSEC-2025-0023

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

body:
### Related

<!--
Include links to any related issues/PRs in a bulleted list, for example:
* Closes #1234
* Part of #1337
-->

### What

Fixes the cargo-deny workflow

```
 error[unsound]: Broadcast channel calls clone in parallel, but does not require `Sync`
    ┌─ /home/runner/work/rerun/rerun/Cargo.lock:686:1
    │
686 │ tokio 1.44.1 registry+https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index
    │ ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ unsound advisory detected
    │
    ├ ID: RUSTSEC-2025-0023
    ├ Advisory: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2025-0023
    ├ The broadcast channel internally calls `clone` on the stored value when
      receiving it, and only requires `T:Send`. This means that using the broadcast
      channel with values that are `Send` but not `Sync` can trigger unsoundness if
      the `clone` implementation makes use of the value being `!Sync`.
```

title: Tweaks for displaymode/active application on incoming servers & applications

labels.name: ui
labels.description: concerns graphical user interface

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

body:
These are all around workflows with incoming "disembodied" blueprint in a readp server context:

(commit by commit)
* don't change display mode aggressively upon seeing a new datasource (this might be just a blueprint and we're looking at a table or a datset table right now)
* if a server was added, show that server (has relatively little effect right now since we don't have a server dataset overview _yet_
* don't set the application id if there's no matching recording for it
    * this is probably the most controversial but also most important one in here: If I send a blueprint to Rerun while I'm looking at something else, I don't want it to switch application id & active entry if we don't have a recording of interest yet.

title: Improved automatically adding unknown catalog server

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

body:
Like

* https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/pull/9482

but more general! Previously, automatically opening the server wouldn't work when we got a url from somewhere else, other than clikcing a link in the viewer. This is easy to run into and made even easier now by

* https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/pull/9493 

This fixes it by checking on new receivers directly.

Also, I made adding preexisting servers a debug message rather than a warning: Today we persist servers, so that means when you run `rerun "rerun+http://localhost:51234"` you get a warning the second time you do so which seems weird.

title: Display thumbnail in tables by generating content-based hash for `Blob` components

labels.name: ui
labels.description: concerns graphical user interface

body: # What This PR enables thumbnail rendering in tables (dataframe view, redap browser, table entries) by "faking" a `RowId` based on the hash of the data. Also, move the thumbnail in front of the metadata label, so that the thumbnails are aligned in a table. **IMPORTANT** - ~This has a non-negligible performance impact on the frame time even when few visible rows, e.g. +1-2ms with only 37 row displayed.~ (Not so much by hashing a reasonable amount.) - It also makes the table noticeably more sluggish to scroll the first time (as the images get cached). - Because of how the row id is computed, there isn't a chance to share the cache of the same images, should they be displayed in some other view. Possible follow-up item (might actually be relatively easy): - https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/issues/9501 ### Before ### After # Performance Test setup: - Relese build - OPF example - Dataframe view with just the image archetype - 40 visible rows ### Baseline https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1cee3dd4-0f81-4ab8-916c-b6c96f0d436d ### After Main observation: CPU frame time increase due to content hashing remains low.

title: Improve `rerun.notebook.Viewer` constructor

labels.name: 🪳 bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: notebook
labels.description: Jupyter notebooks etc

body:
For a while now, the `use_global_recording` param of `rr.notebook.Viewer` didn't actually do as advertised. Setting it to `False` would make the `Viewer` constructor ignore (almost) all other parameters.

The original intent for that parameter was to allow creating a completely empty Viewer. The new behavior is:
- `use_global_recording` defaults to `False` if a `url` is provided.
- `use_global_recording` defaults to `True` otherwise.
- If no explicit recording is provided, and `use_global_recording` is `True`, then we use `get_data_recording` to pick up either the thread-local or global recording.

This means it is now possible to create a completely empty Viewer, and that is the default behavior given no params, and no global recording:
```python
import rerun as rr

rr.notebook.Viewer()
```

If a `url` is provided, then by default we only show that `url`:
```python
import rerun as rr

rr.notebook.Viewer(url="https://app.rerun.io/version/nightly/examples/arkit_scenes.rrd")
```

Using both a `url` and either an explicit/global `recording` is still possible:
```python
import rerun as rr

rec = rr.RecordingStream("rerun_example_dual_recording")
rr.notebook.Viewer(
  url="https://app.rerun.io/version/nightly/examples/arkit_scenes.rrd",
  recording=rec,
)

# alternatively, call `add_recording` later:
rec = rr.RecordingStream("rerun_example_dual_recording")
viewer = rr.notebook.Viewer(
  url="https://app.rerun.io/version/nightly/examples/arkit_scenes.rrd",
)
viewer.add_recording(rec)
viewer.display()

# or just let it pick up the global recording:
rr.init("rerun_example_global_recording_notebook")
rr.notebook.Viewer(
  url="https://app.rerun.io/version/nightly/examples/arkit_scenes.rrd",
  use_global_recording=True,
)
```

If no `url` is provided, we pick up the global recording by default, but it can be turned off:
```python
import rerun as rr

rr.init("rerun_example_global_recording_notebook")
rr.notebook.Viewer() # uses global recording

rr.init("rerun_example_global_recording_notebook")
rr.notebook.Viewer(use_global_recording=False) # will be empty
```

title: Allow passing url to notebook viewer

labels.name: sdk-python
labels.description: Python logging API

labels.name: notebook
labels.description: Jupyter notebooks etc

body:
Makes it possible to open viewers directly with URLs in python notebooks:

Example:
```py
viewer = rr.notebook.Viewer(
   width=1100, height=800,
   url=f"rerun+http://127.0.0.1:51234/dataset/{dataset.id}/data?partition_id={first_episode}"
)
viewer.display()
```

### Related

### What
Introduces a new `ManifestRegistry` endpoint called `RegisterWithDatasetAsync`, which - surprise- is the async version of `RegisterWithDataset`.

It also introduces new methods for the `Tasks` service to query the output of a task once completed.

**Recommended reviewing commit-by-commit**

body:
previously, when clicking a rerun dataplatform url to a catalog you're not connected with, the recording would load fine but not show up on the left hand panel since that depended on the catalog being known.

Alternatives considered:
Show the recording under "disconnected". In some ways this is nicer since nobody asked to connect to the catalog as a whole. But as long as this is light weight in both perf and ux this is probably fine 🤷

title: Support `#datapath` fragment on redap URL

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

labels.name: dataplatform
labels.description: Rerun Data Platform integration

body:
This adds support for appending a data path (e.g. `/some/entity[#42]`) to a redap URL, as a `#fragment`.

When clicking a redap URI with such a fragment, we will focus on that entity.
This is untested, however, and depends on us keeping the focus until the entity is loaded.

A `DataPath` is currently defined as

```rs
pub struct DataPath {
    pub entity_path: EntityPath,
    pub instance: Option<Instance>,
    pub component_name: Option<ComponentName>,
}
```

We will wanna extend this in the future to support tagging, and maybe even a timepoint.

### Extending it with time point

It's not clear how to specify _both_ time _and_ a data path in the fragment 🤔  I guess we need to use a special character, like comma:

`#/entity/path,log_tick=42` maybe

…and then comes the trouble of escaping

title: Fix 2D image split heuristic

labels.name: 🦟 regression
labels.description: A thing that used to work in an earlier release

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

labels.name: heuristics
labels.description: Heuristics for placing views, fallback provider, etc.

body:
### Related

* Fixes https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/issues/9363
* Regression caused by https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/pull/9308

### What

As far as I can tell the main breakage occurred because previously we tracked which visualizable entities remain in the subtree during image split computation. That's fixed by stopping image split detection when there's no images anymore (duh! ;-)). There was another issue where we'd count videos and encoded images both as each other additionally.

Adds a simple snapshot test for the spawn heuristic which was confirmed catching this! First of its kind 😱

body: ### Related * Part of: #8593 * Will unlock: #7204 ### What This brings a very basic table entry to the Rerun viewer. Tables are essentially dataframes, can contain Rerun-native components, but don't have to adhere to some of the restrictions that we place on regular entities (i.e. we don't require indexation columns). ### Testing The following will create a _very_ basic table in-memory. A follow-up PR will add GRPC-based sending of dataframes. ``` RERUN_EXPERIMENTAL_TABLE=1 pixi run rerun ``` ### Known issues * [x] Deleting all recordings switches to welcome screen although tables still present. (tracked via #9465) * [x] Finding the closest entry after closing is not implemented (will be closed via #9464)

title: Infer image/video channel index from LeRobot metadata

labels.name: 📺 re_viewer
labels.description: affects re_viewer itself

body:
### What

Most LeRobot datasets come with a name for each dimension of an `image` or `video` feature. This means we can attempt to infer the index, and do less guessing.

Additionally I rewrote the `Names` parsing to be a bit more general and support even more possible ways to name the dimensions of your feature!

title: Introduce `attr.rerun.state` to our codegen

labels.name: 📖 documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

labels.name: 🧑‍💻 dev experience
labels.description: developer experience (excluding CI)

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

body:
### Related
* Part of https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/issues/9427

### What
To make it easier to manage the "stabilization" state of our types, I've introduced a new attribute (that replaces several old ones).

I will make it mandatory in a future PR.

### Docs for `attribute "attr.rerun.state";`
Must be set on all archetypes and components.

Must have one of the following values:
- `unstable`
- `stable`
- `deprecated`

### `unstable`
Used for types that are likely to be removed or changed significantly,
and in a way that the data won't be backwards compatible.

### `stable`
Used for types that are unlikely to be removed or changed significantly.
If they are changed, we will make sure that the old data can still be read.

### `deprecated`
Marks something as deprecated followed by a (mandatory!) migration note.

If specified on an object (struct/enum/union), it becomes deprecated such
that using the object should emit a warning in all target languages.
Furthermore, documentation will mention that the object is deprecated and display
the specified migration note.

If set, you MUST also set `attr.docs.deprecated_since` and `attr.rerun.deprecated_notice` to a non-empty string.

title: Introduce URI scheme for dataset and add support for opening remote recordings using the new API

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

labels.name: dataplatform
labels.description: Rerun Data Platform integration

body:
Introduce the URL scheme for downloading dataset data:

```
$ORIGIN/dataset/$DATASET_ID/data?partition_id=$PARTITION_ID[&time_range=$TIME_RANGE]
```

Relevant slack thread for the backing discussion: https://rerunio.slack.com/archives/C08EWSCS26P/p1743092658188489

For now, we only support fetching a single partition, so the `partition_id` parameter is mandatory. In the future, we will support arbitrary queries.  The `time_range` parameter is optional. If used, the time range will be highlighted, but filtering on actual time range when fetching chunk is not yet supported (https://github.com/rerun-io/dataplatform/issues/474).

NOTES:
- Review commit-by-commit. The first commit is a pure move refactor.
- I've updated the existing `Recording` tests instead of adding new ones, because this stuff will soon be removed anyways.

title: Fix optional notebook package import

labels.name: 🪳 bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: sdk-python
labels.description: Python logging API

labels.name: notebook
labels.description: Jupyter notebooks etc

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

body:
`rerun_notebook` is an optional dependency. Right now, we attempt to import `rerun_notebook` unconditionally, and ignore the `ImportError` if there is one. It turns out this is not enough, because the `rerun_notebook` package is attempting to load a file which does not exist, which raises `FileNotFoundError` instead.

We can assume the widget always exists if the package is imported, so I updated the logic to actually check if the package is installed, and only attempt to import it if so.

Testing:
```
rm -rf .pixi/envs/examples
pixi run py-build-examples
pixi run -e examples minimal
```
Running this on main results in a `FileNotFoundError`, which is gone on this PR.

title: Don't trigger callbacks on welcome screen

labels.name: 🪳 bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: exclude from changelog
labels.description: PRs with this won't show up in CHANGELOG.md

body:
Right now when the Viewer is "empty" (=no active recordings), it still has an active app, which is the welcome screen, and that has an empty recording in it. As a result, we trigger time update callbacks, even if the user doesn't see any active recordings. This is not only confusing but also actively harmful behavior for anyone who's trying to use callbacks to build on top of the Viewer.

The solution here is to disable timeline callbacks if we don't have an active recording. We define that as "has an app id which isn't the welcome screen app id".

Additionally, we don't trigger timeline callbacks if the active timeline is empty (=has no timepoints).

title: Use multi-dimensional scalar values when loading LeRobot dataset

labels.name: 📺 re_viewer
labels.description: affects re_viewer itself

body:
### Related

* Closes #9318 

### What

We now use the multi-scalar support added in #9005 when loading multi-dimensional action/observation values from a LeRobot dataset.
This is the preferred as it aligns with how data is consumed during training, each frame’s actions or observations are expected as a single tensor rather than a collection of separate scalar values. Storing it as one neat array makes it easier to query action/observation values back out of Rerun, as there's now just a single entity path.

title: Add `detach_process` option to `spawn`

labels.name: sdk-python
labels.description: Python logging API

labels.name: sdk-rust
labels.description: Rust logging API

labels.name: sdk-cpp
labels.description: C/C++ API specific

body:
### Related Discussion  
For more context, see this thread:  
https://discord.com/channels/1062300748202921994/1354497232103145642  
Related to: https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/commit/1942b43262252e1d0c887623c30451c0cdd6b9ad

### What’s New  
This update introduces a `detach_process` option for the `spawn()` method in the `Viewer` (available in Rust, Python, and C++).  

### Why It Matters  
This gives client code control over whether the `Viewer` runs independently of the parent process or remains tied to it. Keeping it attached ensures the `Viewer` closes when the parent process terminates with `SIGINT`. Detaching (default behavior) allows it to persist if needed.

While this achieves the desired functionality, a future improvement could be adding a proper `close()` method to gracefully shut down the `Viewer` context.  

### Note on Web Support  
This change wasn’t applied to the web API since I'm not sure how process management behaves there.

### How it was tested?
(Python only) Small edit to the `minimal.py` to evaluate the behavior

```python3
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Demonstrates the most barebone usage of the Rerun SDK."""

from __future__ import annotations

import sys

import numpy as np
import rerun as rr  # pip install rerun-sdk
import time


def main() -> None:
    # sanity-check since all other example scripts take arguments:
    assert len(sys.argv) == 1, f"{sys.argv[0]} does not take any arguments"

    rr.init("rerun_example_minimal")
    rr.spawn(detach_process=False)

    positions = np.vstack([xyz.ravel() for xyz in np.mgrid[3 * [slice(-10, 10, 10j)]]]).T
    colors = np.vstack([rgb.ravel() for rgb in np.mgrid[3 * [slice(0, 255, 10j)]]]).astype(np.uint8).T

    rr.log("my_points", rr.Points3D(positions, colors=colors, radii=0.5))
    time.sleep(10)  # CRTL+C here: Viewer process will exit


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

As expected, when `detach_process=False` if we send a `SIGINT` to the application, the Viewer exits and the PID assigned to it is retired.

body:
### Related

* Fixes https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/issues/9391
* Exposed by https://github.com/rerun-io/rerun/pull/9381

### What

The new property UI would call multiple `EntityPath::data_ui` sequentially. These would lead to `component_list_ui` to be called, and because they had a hard-coded id, there would be cross-talk between the scopes' underlying egui memory storage. This PR makes the id unique.
